00025 /*
00026  * Ugly hack:
00027  *
00028  * On non-gcc compilers one can effectively force alignment to be 8 bytes by
00029  * inserting dummy value of any type that requires 8-byte alignment into 
00030  * struct. double seems like something that requires 8-byte alignment.
00031  */
00032 
00033 #if __SIZEOF_POINTER__ == 8
00034 # define DFSCH_ALIGN8_ATTR  
00035 # define DFSCH_ALIGN8_DUMMY 
00036 #else
00037 # ifdef __GNUC__
00038 #  define DFSCH_ALIGN8_ATTR  __attribute__ ((__aligned__(8)))
00039 #  define DFSCH_ALIGN8_DUMMY 
00040 # else
00041 #  define DFSCH_ALIGN8_ATTR  
00042 #  define DFSCH_ALIGN8_DUMMY double alignment_dummy_value;
00043 # endif
00044 #endif

00091 #define DFSCH_DECLARE_PRIMITIVE(name, documentation)    \
00092   static dfsch_primitive_t p_##name = {                 \
00093     DFSCH_PRIMITIVE_TYPE,                               \
00094     p_##name##_impl,                                    \
00095     NULL,                                               \
00096     0,                                                  \
00097     #name,                                              \
00098     documentation                                       \
00099   }
00100   
00101 #define DFSCH_DECLARE_PRIMITIVE_EX(name, baton, flags, documentation)   \
00102   static dfsch_primitive_t p_##name = {                                 \
00103     DFSCH_PRIMITIVE_TYPE,                                               \
00104     p_##name##_impl,                                                    \
00105     baton,                                                              \
00106     flags,                                                              \
00107     #name,                                                              \
00108     documentation                                                       \
00109   }
00110 
00111 #define DFSCH_PRIMITIVE_HEAD(name)                                      \
00112   static dfsch_object_t* p_##name##_impl(void* baton,                   \
00113                                          dfsch_object_t* args,          \
00114                                          dfsch_tail_escape_t* esc)
00115   
00116 #define DFSCH_DEFINE_PRIMITIVE(name, flags)     \
00117   DFSCH_PRIMITIVE_HEAD(name);                   \
00118   DFSCH_DECLARE_PRIMITIVE(name, flags);         \
00119   DFSCH_PRIMITIVE_HEAD(name)
00120 
00121 #define DFSCH_PRIMITIVE_REF(name) ((dfsch_object_t*)&p_##name)

00274 #define DFSCH_SLOT_ACCESS_RW          0
00275 #define DFSCH_SLOT_ACCESS_DEBUG_WRITE 1
00276 #define DFSCH_SLOT_ACCESS_RO          2
00277 #define DFSCH_SLOT_ACCESS_DEBUG_READ  3
00278 
00279 #define DFSCH_SLOT_TYPE_HEAD(name, documentation)                     \
00280   {DFSCH_SLOT_TYPE_TYPE, DFSCH_SLOT_TYPE, sizeof(dfsch_slot_t), name, \
00281       NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, documentation}
00282 
00283 #define DFSCH_OBJECT_SLOT(struct, name, access, doc)          \
00284   {DFSCH_OBJECT_SLOT_TYPE, #name, offsetof(struct, name), access, doc}
00285 #define DFSCH_BOOLEAN_SLOT(struct, name, access, doc)                   \
00286   {DFSCH_BOOLEAN_SLOT_TYPE, #name, offsetof(struct, name), access, doc}
00287 #define DFSCH_STRING_SLOT(struct, name, access, doc)                    \
00288   {DFSCH_STRING_SLOT_TYPE, #name, offsetof(struct, name), access, doc}
00289 #define DFSCH_SIZE_T_SLOT(struct, name, access, doc)                    \
00290   {DFSCH_SIZE_T_SLOT_TYPE, #name, offsetof(struct, name), access, doc}
00291 #define DFSCH_INT_SLOT(struct, name, access, doc)               \
00292   {DFSCH_INT_SLOT_TYPE, #name, offsetof(struct, name), access, doc}
00293 #define DFSCH_LONG_SLOT(struct, name, access, doc)              \
00294   {DFSCH_LONG_SLOT_TYPE, #name, offsetof(struct, name), access, doc}
00295 #define DFSCH_SLOT_TERMINATOR {NULL, NULL, 0, NULL}
00296 
00297 
00298 /*
00299  * Objects should be always 8-byte aligned in memory, even on 32b platforms.
00300  * When this is not true this encoding will not work. In fact, there are other
00301  * plausible representations, but introducing (backtroducing?) type pointers 
00302  * into pair is not good idea, as any overhead on pairs consumes memory, and
00303  * more importantly increases amount of cache misses.
00304  *
00305  * Object pointer tag meaning:
00306  * 000 - Normal object, first word is type
00307  * 010 - Mutable pair
00308  * 100 - Symbol
00309  * 110 - Immutable pair
00310  * x01 - Fixnum (cannot be 11, because of invalid object marker)
00311  * x11 - Entry of cdr-coded list (pointer points to WORD(!), not object)
00312  *
00313  * And there are two special values of object pointer:
00314  * All zeroes - empty list
00315  * All ones - invalid object marker (e.g. end of CDR-coded list or invalid 
00316  *            weak reference, with important point is that weak-references 
00317  *            are set to this value by GC, and this is not simply changed)
00318  *
00319  * Idea is that structure of loaded code should consist of annotated pairs 
00320  * and CDR-coded sections. Immutable pairs are strictly not necessary, but 
00321  * still are good idea (for consistency and might be useful in user-code)
00322  */
00323 
00324 extern dfsch_type_t dfsch_pair_type;
00325 #define DFSCH_PAIR_TYPE (&dfsch_pair_type)
00326 
00327 extern dfsch_type_t dfsch_tagged_types[4];
00328 #define DFSCH_MUTABLE_PAIR_TYPE (&(dfsch_tagged_types[1]))
00329 #define DFSCH_SYMBOL_TYPE (&(dfsch_tagged_types[2]))
00330 #define DFSCH_IMMUTABLE_PAIR_TYPE (&(dfsch_tagged_types[3]))
00331 #define DFSCH_COMPACT_LIST_TYPE (&(dfsch_tagged_types[0]))
00332 
00333 #define DFSCH_INVALID_OBJECT ((dfsch_object_t*)((size_t) -1))
00334 
00335 typedef struct dfsch_pair_t {
00336   dfsch_object_t* car;
00337   dfsch_object_t* cdr;
00338   DFSCH_ALIGN8_DUMMY
00339 } DFSCH_ALIGN8_ATTR dfsch_pair_t;
00340 
00341 
00342 #define DFSCH__FAST_CDR_CODED_P(pair)           \
00343   ((((size_t)(pair)) & 0x03) == 0x03)
00344 #define DFSCH__COMPACT_LIST_CDR(ptr)                                    \
00345   (((dfsch_object_t**)(((size_t)(ptr)) & ~0x03))[1] == DFSCH_INVALID_OBJECT ? \
00346    ((dfsch_object_t**)(((size_t)(ptr)) & ~0x03))[2] :                   \
00347    (dfsch_object_t*)(((dfsch_object_t**)(ptr))+1))
00348 
00349 #define DFSCH_PAIR_REF(obj)                                             \
00350   ((dfsch_pair_t*)(((size_t)(obj)) & (DFSCH__FAST_CDR_CODED_P(obj) ?    \
00351                                       ~0x03L : ~0x07L)))
00352 #define DFSCH_MAKE_CLIST(ptr)\
00353   ((dfsch_object_t*)(((size_t)(ptr)) | 0x03))  
00354 #define DFSCH_TAG_ENCODE(obj, kind)             \
00355   ((dfsch_object_t*)(((size_t)(obj)) | (kind << 1)))
00356 #define DFSCH_TAG_REF(obj)                      \
00357   ((void*)(((size_t)(obj)) & ~0x07L))
00358 
00359 #define DFSCH_FAST_CAR(obj)                     \
00360   (DFSCH_PAIR_REF(obj)->car)
00361 #define DFSCH_FAST_CDR_MUT(obj)                 \
00362   (DFSCH_PAIR_REF(obj)->cdr)
00363 #define DFSCH_FAST_CDR(obj)                                     \
00364   (DFSCH__FAST_CDR_CODED_P(obj) ?                               \
00365    DFSCH__COMPACT_LIST_CDR(obj):                                \
00366    (DFSCH_PAIR_REF(obj)->cdr))
00367 #define DFSCH_PAIR_P(obj) (((((size_t)(obj)) & 0x02) == 0x02))
00368 #define DFSCH_SYMBOL_P(obj) (((((size_t)(obj)) & 0x07) == 0x04))
00369 #define DFSCH_FIXNUM_P(obj) ((((size_t)(obj)) & 0x03) == 0x01)
00370 
00371 #define DFSCH_FIXNUM_REF(obj)                   \
00372   (((long)(((ptrdiff_t)(obj)) & ~0x03L)) >> 2)
00373 #define DFSCH_MAKE_FIXNUM(obj)                                  \
00374   ((dfsch_object_t*) ((((ptrdiff_t)(obj)) << 2) | 0x01L))
00375 #define DFSCH_FIXNUM_MAX (PTRDIFF_MAX / 4)
00376 #define DFSCH_FIXNUM_MIN (PTRDIFF_MIN / 4)
00377 
00378 
00379 #define DFSCH_TYPE_OF(obj)                                              \
00380   ((obj)?(                                                              \
00381           (((size_t)(obj)) & 0x07) == 0 ? ((dfsch_object_t*)(obj))->type: \
00382           ((((size_t)(obj)) & 0x01) == 0x01 ?                           \
00383            ((((size_t)(obj)) & 0x02) == 0x00 ?                          \
00384             DFSCH_FIXNUM_TYPE : DFSCH_COMPACT_LIST_TYPE):               \
00385            &(dfsch_tagged_types[(((size_t)(obj)) & 0x06) >> 1]))):        \
00386    DFSCH_EMPTY_LIST_TYPE)
00387 
00388   
00389 #define DFSCH_INSTANCE_P(o, t)                                  \
00390   ((DFSCH_TYPE_OF(o) == (t))||dfsch_instance_p((o), (t)))
00391 
00392 #define DFSCH_ASSERT_TYPE(o, t)                                         \
00393   ((DFSCH_TYPE_OF((o)) == (t)) ? ((void*)(o)) : dfsch_assert_type((o), (t)))
00394 #define DFSCH_ASSERT_INSTANCE(o, t)                                     \
00395   (DFSCH_INSTANCE_P((o), (t)) ? (o) : dfsch_assert_instance((o), (t)))
00396 
00397 #define DFSCH_ASSERT_PAIR(p)                                            \
00398   (DFSCH_PAIR_P((p)) ? (p) : dfsch_assert_instance((p), DFSCH_PAIR_TYPE))
00399

00402   DFSCH_ALIGN8_DUMMY
00403 } DFSCH_ALIGN8_ATTR dfsch__symbol_t;

00405 extern dfsch__symbol_t dfsch__static_symbols[];
00406 #define DFSCH__STATIC_SYMBOL(index)                     \
00407   DFSCH_TAG_ENCODE(dfsch__static_symbols + (index), 2)
00408 
00409 #define DFSCH_SYM_TRUE DFSCH__STATIC_SYMBOL(0)
00410 #define DFSCH_SYM_QUOTE DFSCH__STATIC_SYMBOL(1)
00411 #define DFSCH_SYM_QUASIQUOTE DFSCH__STATIC_SYMBOL(2)
00412 #define DFSCH_SYM_UNQUOTE DFSCH__STATIC_SYMBOL(3)
00413 #define DFSCH_SYM_UNQUOTE_SPLICING DFSCH__STATIC_SYMBOL(4)
00414 #define DFSCH_SYM_ELSE DFSCH__STATIC_SYMBOL(5)
00415 #define DFSCH_SYM_BOLD_RIGHT_ARROW DFSCH__STATIC_SYMBOL(6)
